properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 3:51AM CST until February 5 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
...Light Wintry Precipitation Followed By Accumulating Snow...

.A light wintry mix of precipitation will spread from northwest to
southeast across the region this afternoon and tonight as a low
pressure system approaches from the southwest. Snow will then
develop from southwest to northeast across the area on Wednesday
and may be heavy at times along and north of the Interstate 44
corridor. A wintry mix will remain possible Wednesday across
south-central Missouri.

* WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of a
light glaze.

* WHERE...Texas, Dent, Wright, Christian and Stone Counties.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are
possible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and potentially a wintry mix look
increasingly likely for Wednesday. Portions of this advisory may
therefore be extended.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible
power outages.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY
